Clause: while it's fresh in my head:
which I completely disagree with (at least as stated here).
(such as speech) is expected to communicate, essentially, a "mental picture" of the 2-dimensional form of an expression.
(Rationale: since almost all mathematics is conventionally expressed in 2-dimensional graphical form, most notations in that medium have no standard version in other media.)
Renderings in speech need to convey more than a "2D picture" of the expression.
Check out (listen to ) some of the demos on my AsTeR WWW site--
they make the point about spoken renderings
being *independent* of the visual 2D layout far better than I am capable of in a plain-text email message.
Given that the contentious statement appears in our "rationale" document,
it sufficiently importatn to have clarified.
